item.title: MapDB 1.0 will be released in January
item.description: I am happy to announce that everything is on track for MapDB 1.0 to be released on January 2014.

item.title: MapDB 0.9.7 released
item.description: MapDB 0.9.7 was just released. Fixed locking issues on Windows. Concurrent Transactions (TxMaker) reworked and finally fixed.

item.title: MapDB 0.9.6 released
item.description: MapDB 0.9.6 was just released. Concurrent Transactions (TxMaker) almost fixed. Backward incompatible store format change. Snapshots are no longer enabled by default.

item.title: MapDB 0.9.5 released
item.description: MapDB 0.9.5 was just released. Fixed some data corruption issues. CRC32 replaced by faster Adler32. I will be offline until 4th Sept.

item.title: MapDB 0.9.4 released
item.description: MapDB 0.9.4 was just released. It is not backward compatible with previous releases. Many improvements.

item.title: MapDB 0.9 format support
item.description: MapDB has currently semi-stable branch 0.9.x. My plan was to keep stable API and storage format. However to support some new features (store size limit, async API) I have to make changes in storage format, which are not backward compatible. Also now I work full-time and project is evolving much faster than I expected.

item.title: MapDB Reloaded
item.description: Last month I wrote aboutthe future of MapDB. It was not very optimistic. MapDB is my hobby project and the time I could give it is severely limited. This led to some absurd situations: despite having a very fast db-engine I would not publish any performance benchmarks. I also discouraged possible users so I would not have to deal with support emails.

item.title: MapDB Future
item.description: MapDB 0.9.x was released a few weeks ago. Now that the project entersusable alpha phase, is time to talk about the future.

item.title: 3 billion items in Java Map with 16 GB RAM
item.description: One rainy evening I meditated about memory management in Java and how effectively Java collections utilise memory. I made simple experiment, how much entries can I insert into Java Map with 16 GB of RAM?

item.title: JDBM4 renamed to MapDB
item.description: 'JDBM' (Java Database Manager) name has long history. Original 'DBM' (Database Manager) has been introduced in seventies. Java version started in 2001 and first stable version was introduced in 2005. Until 2012 it has dozen forks including JDBM2,3,4 and ApacheDS.
